FUNC.NAME: battery
FUNC.SYNOPSIS: is used to set the attributes of the battery indicator and retrieve the status of the battery.

PARAM.NAME: getSmartBatteryStatus
PARAM.DESC: Triggers a SmartBatteryEvent. This returns attributes about the battery such as number of charge cycles and date of manufacture. Please note that the Smart Battery is only supported on Symbol Technologies Inc Devices running Windows Embedded Handheld or CE and is dependant on the available hardware.

PARAM.NAME: getBatteryStatus
PARAM.DESC: Triggers a BatteryEvent. This returns attributes about the battery such as battery life and AC line status etc.

PARAM.NAME: getBatteryDiagnostics
PARAM.DESC: Triggers a BatteryDiagnosticEvent. This returns attributes about the battery such as battery expiration, charge time predictions and more.

PARAM.NAME: visibility
PARAM.DESC: Sets whether or not the battery indicator is shown

PARAM.NAME: left
PARAM.DESC: Sets the horizontal position of the battery indicator in pixels. If it is negative the then indicator will be moved off screen

PARAM.NAME: top
PARAM.DESC: Sets the vertical position of the battery indicator in pixels. if value is negative then indicator will be moved off screen

PARAM.NAME: layout
PARAM.DESC: Sets the orientation of the battery icon

PARAM.NAME: color
PARAM.DESC: RGB value that sets the color of the battery indicator using HTML web colors

PARAM.NAME: sampleInterval
PARAM.DESC: The battery refresh interval, specified in milli seconds. A value of 0 disables the automatic refresh.

PARAM.NAME: setSystemNotifications
PARAM.DESC: Sets the system notifications for battery. If we enable the system Notifications then its recommended to disable the auto refresh by setting the sampleInterval to 0 otherwise the eventSource in the battery status gets overwritten to "Timed Interval". Please note that the system notifications are reported only once by the operating system and hence the low battery conditions are not reported if the device is already in low battery condition.

PARAM.NAME: tripDuration
PARAM.DESC: Sets the desired working time out of the cradle, which is used in subsequent power related calculations. If set to 0, the default value of 45 minutes will be used. Applicable to MC18

PARAM.NAME: averageCurrentConsumption
PARAM.DESC: Sets an average current consumption that is used in subsequent power related calculations. If set to 0, the value will be provided by driver based on the running average. Applicable to MC18

TAG.TAG_NOTES: The BatteryEvent gives an indication of the remaining battery level. Once registered for you will receive a BatteryEvent at regular intervals, as specified by the BatteryRefresh configuration setting.

RETVAL.NAME: acLineStatus
RETVAL.DESC: The AC line status (whether or not on external power).

RETVAL.NAME: batteryLifePercent
RETVAL.DESC: Displays the remaining battery power as a percentage. For some Zebra Android devices, the API will return a value of 255 at all times while the battery is being charged. The same value also might be displayed for a few seconds initially after reboot while the battery is being discharged. This is in accordance with hardware design specs and should be taken into account when using the API.

RETVAL.NAME: backupBatteryLifePercent
RETVAL.DESC: Remaining backup battery power as a percentage.

RETVAL.NAME: eventSource
RETVAL.DESC: Reason for event firing ("Timed Interval", "User Request", "Low Battery", "Critical Battery", "AC Connect" and "AC Disconnect"). "Timed Interval" is when the status gets refreshed automatically and "User Request" is when the user manually calls getBatteryStatus method and the remaining are generated through system notifications.

RETVAL.NAME: batteryLifeKnown
RETVAL.DESC: Battery life will not be readable for a period of time after removing from an AC power source. This parameter will state whether the batteryLifePercent is accurate ("true"/"false").

RETVAL.NAME: backupBatteryLifeKnown
RETVAL.DESC: Backup battery life will not be readable for a period of time after removing from an AC power source. This parameter will state whether the backupBatteryLifePercent is accurate ("true"/"false").

TAG.TAG_NOTES: Returns various parameters relating to battery charge and battery hardware. Not all return values may be supported by all batteries. Not supported on Android.

RETVAL.NAME: serialNumber
RETVAL.DESC: The serial number of the battery

RETVAL.NAME: partNumber
RETVAL.DESC: The Symbol part number of the battery, e.g. 21-65587 Rev. A

RETVAL.NAME: batteryChargeCycles
RETVAL.DESC: The number of times the battery has been charged. Partial charges are aggregated, therefore each charge cycle count represents one full charge / discharge cycle. The battery charge cycle count gets updated when the battery charging state changes from charging to not charging. Cycle count may not accuratley predict the life of a battery.

RETVAL.NAME: ratedCapacity
RETVAL.DESC: Rated capacity of the battery in mAh

RETVAL.NAME: manufactureDate
RETVAL.DESC: Date the battery was manufactured expressed as MM/DD/YYYY.

RETVAL.NAME: stateOfHealth
RETVAL.DESC: "Healthy", "Unhealthy" or "Unknown"

TAG.TAG_NOTES: The BatteryDiagnosticEvent returns parameters for further battery analysis. Not all return values may be supported by all batteries.

RETVAL.NAME: stateOfHealthPercent
RETVAL.DESC: The current maximum battery capacity as a percentage of the battery rated capacity.

RETVAL.NAME: batteryCapacityPercent
RETVAL.DESC: The remaining battery capacity percentage.

RETVAL.NAME: batteryCapacityMinutes
RETVAL.DESC: The remaining battery capacity in minutes. Calculations are based on the AverageCurrentConsumption parameter.

RETVAL.NAME: batteryExpirationInMonths
RETVAL.DESC: Prediction in number of months when the battery should be replaced.

RETVAL.NAME: previousBatteryReplacement
RETVAL.DESC: Duration in Days since the battery was last Replaced.

RETVAL.NAME: timeSinceLastColdBoot
RETVAL.DESC: Time in minutes since the device was last cold booted.

RETVAL.NAME: requiredChargeTime
RETVAL.DESC: Calculates charge time required in minutes based on the TripDuration and AverageCurrentConsumption parameters.

RETVAL.NAME: chargingTime
RETVAL.DESC: Time in minuteâ€™s terminal was in cradle charging.

EXAMPLE.DESC: The following example shows the battery indicator, sets the x and y co-ordinates to 50, the color of the indicator to red and positions the indicator at the bottom of the screen growing from right to left:
EXAMPLE.CODE: <META HTTP-Equiv="battery" Content="visibility:visible"> <META HTTP-Equiv="battery" Content="Left:50"> <META HTTP-Equiv="battery" Content="Top:50"> <META HTTP-Equiv="battery" Content="Layout:Left"> <META HTTP-Equiv="battery" Content="Color:#FF0000">

EXAMPLE.DESC: Example shown above can also be written as shown below
Parameters can also be concatenated as shown below
EXAMPLE.CODE: <META HTTP-Equiv="Battery-Left" Content="Left:50"> <META HTTP-Equiv="Battery-Top" Content="Top:50"> <META HTTP-Equiv="Battery-Color" Content="Color:#FF0000">
